snippet: Three cases have emerged in the country since it was declared free of the virus on May 9, highlighting the continuing threat of viral outbreaks in West Africa.
abstract: Three new cases of Ebola emerge in Liberia nearly two months after country was declared free of deadly virus.

byline.contributor: Sheri Fink contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Three cases have emerged in the country since it was declared free of the virus on May 9, highlighting the continuing threat of viral outbreaks in West Africa.

headline.main: Liberia Reports New Cases of Ebola
headline.print_headline: Ebola Revival Is New Test for Liberia
